title: It's the New Saying Among Tech CEOs: I Apologize
description: Facebook, Twitter and other firms are slashing jobs, and their leaders’ mea culpas are abundant.

title: Elon Musk Tells Twitter Employees Remote Work Is Over
description: The billionaire owner says the economic picture is dire; ‘The road ahead is arduous and will require intense work to succeed’

title: New Technology Lets Farmers Use Land for Both Solar Panels and Crops
description: By using elevated panels, researchers hope they can generate electricity without reducing yields on the crops growing underneath.

title: Amazon Has Launched a Cost-Cutting Review Focused on Unprofitable Business Units
description: CEO Andy Jassy is leading the review including the devices unit, which includes Alexa and has had an annual operating loss of $5 billion in some recent years, documents show.

title: FTX Tapped Into Customer Accounts to Fund Risky Bets
description: Crypto exchange FTX lent billions of dollars worth of customer assets to fund bets by its affiliated trading firm, Alameda Research, setting the stage for the exchange’s implosion, a person familiar with the matter said.

title: How Many People Are Watching 'Thursday Night Football'? That Is Up for Debate
description: Analyzing ratings for Amazon Prime Video’s ‘Thursday Night Football’ has become as complicated as some National Football League rules.

title: Apple Supply Crunch on Premium iPhone Threatens to Derail Record Sales Run
description: Apple’s warning this week about iPhone supply limitations threatens one of biggest drivers of the company’s record-breaking sales in recent years: persuading customers to buy its priciest smartphones.

title: Layoffs Aren't a Good Look for Big Tech's Growth Story
description: Meta Platforms, Twitter and other tech companies have shown they are economically sensitive, puncturing the myth of “permanent acceleration.”

title: Foxconn Says Aims to Swiftly Recover iPhone Production Levels at Covid-Hit Site
description: Foxconn is still operating its main iPhone plant in Zhengzhou under a closed-loop system.

title: Twitter's Moderation Boss Is an Unlikely Ally of Elon Musk
description: Yoel Roth, who has been accused of being anticonservative, polices the site’s content.

title: Paul Allen's Art Collection Sets Record With $1.5 Billion Sale
description: The auction at Christie’s offered a trove of trophies from artists like Cézanne, Seurat and Botticelli.

title: Rivian's Losses Mount as It Continues to Burn Through Cash
description: The electric-vehicle startup said it lost $1.74 billion in the third quarter as it continued to struggle with higher material costs and underused assembly lines.
